moves.5. Nc3 Nbd7: Black's position is already looking constricted.
moves.6. Bd3 Bd6 7. O-O O-O: Both sides castle early. But Black will end up weakening his castled position, and it will cost him the game.
moves.8. e4 dxe4: Black gives up the center. With his already-cramped position, this development is ominous.
moves.9. Nxe4 Nxe4 10. Bxe4 Nf6: The exchange has eased Black's game slightly. He is still under pressure, however.
moves.11. Bc2 h6: A disastrous move. White was threatening B-N5 and Q-Q3 with mate threat, but this weakening of his castled position just makes things worse.
moves.12. b3 b6 13. Bb2: White threatens P-Q5, opening the long diagonal.
moves.14... g6: Oh, dear. Why weaken the already weak K-side further?
moves.15. Rae1 Nh5: This move seals Black's fate. 15... Q-K2 was the only chance.
moves.16. Bc1 Kg7 17. Rxe6: The final attack is beginning. 17... PxR??? is of course impossible [18 QxPch K-R1 18 Q-R7 mate.]
moves.17... Nf6 18. Ne5: Black's doom is just a matter of moves.
moves.18... c5: 18... BxN would hold out a little longer. But at this stage it matters little.
moves.19. Bxh6+ Kxh6 20. Nxf7+: Black resigns before he can be mated. [20... RxN 21 QxP mate, or 20... K-N2 21 QxP mate, or 20... K-R2 21 QxP mate., or 20... K-R4 21 QxPch K-R5 22 P-N3ch and mate in 2.]
